TopicTitle: [1.0.5] Behemoth Aerospace Engineering Large Parts v1.3.5 (2015-11-15)

Articles.Content:
> 
> Finally, huge procedural fairings! And also fueled Nose Cones, I love this stockalike pack as much as NearFuture packs and Necrobones ones ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

I'm glad you enjoy it!

Nice to see Kottabos do a review on these parts! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CVAygrQ98AI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> Nice to see Kottabos do a review on these parts! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I couldn't agree more! Ordinary users will probably never notice, but I actually spotted a couple of things I want to correct on some of the parts in the video. It's always nice with a new perspective - so feel free to post pictures and videos of what you're doing with Behemoth Aerospace Engineering Large Parts in this topic. It might just help me spot more embarrassing errors of mine.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-06T10:41:32Z" title="06/06/2015 10:41  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 6, 2015</time> by greystork**
Have you ever considered converting to DDS textures? I don't like how much memory this mod uses.

> 
> Have you ever considered converting to DDS textures? I don't like how much memory this mod uses.

All textures are in DDS format. Most fuel tanks have their own texture, however, which is something I've considered changing.

Just a note on your size naming scheme. Size 5 should be 6.25m and size 6 would then be 7.5m, and 10m would be size 8. Otherwise a very cool pack, although some fuel tanks could use a bit of detailing.

> 
> Just a note on your size naming scheme. Size 5 should be 6.25m and size 6 would then be 7.5m, and 10m would be size 8. Otherwise a very cool pack, although some fuel tanks could use a bit of detailing.

Thanks. When we get up in the larger sizes, I don't think maintaining the 1.25m gap is very useful, so at least on *greystork*'s island, size 5 is 7.5m and size 6 is 10m.

Here's a little news update, so you guys have something to look forward to!

Version 1.2.0 is in the skunkworks, and this is what I have planned for it:

- Extremely heavy solid rocket boosters to fit the three stack sizes.
- Extra long landing legs that clear the Ajax engines.
- Large radial decoupler with built-in sepratrons.
- Ablative heat shields.

I estimate that the new version will be out in about a week's time. Stay tuned!

Ooooooooooooh that sounds awesome!

Wonder if I can make super-heavy rockets out of srbs.

edit: Lol, the big fairings can almost seamlessly enclose my 440 ton mothership. Very nice.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-11T01:57:12Z" title="06/11/2015 01:57  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 11, 2015</time> by Temeter**

Those textures look so amazingly awesome!

Great job! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Lol, the big fairings can almost seamlessly enclose my 440 ton mothership. Very nice.

Nice to hear that they're useful!

> 
> Those textures look so amazingly awesome!

I'm glad you like them!

Yeah, this mod really covers some major holes at the top end of the scale slider... BUG: The agent configuration crashes the agent loader (see exception in log file), so the only agents you will see in your mcc are any agents loaded before the BAE agent is loaded.

> 
> i think i found a bug in this mod,i installed them mod,run the ame and now i cant enter into the vab in my career mod.
> at first i was not sure that it was the BAE folder that causing this,so i removed it and everything was fine again.
> 
> EDIT: ok so i try to reinstall,and this mod do not work in career mod,it works fine in sandbox.

Delete the agency folder in the mod, it will fix the issue something is not set right with the agency cfg file and causes the null reference error. I had the same exact error, regardless if I started a new career or loaded an older one.

> 
> Yeah, this mod really covers some major holes at the top end of the scale slider... BUG: The agent configuration crashes the agent loader (see exception in log file), so the only agents you will see in your mcc are any agents loaded before the BAE agent is loaded.

Thanks for pointing that out! It will be fixed in the upcoming update.

Edit: Now fixed in version 1.2.0.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-15T19:27:54Z" title="06/15/2015 07:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 15, 2015</time> by greystork**

Version 1.2.0 is out!

Here's what's new in parts:

- Extremely heavy solid rocket boosters to fit the three stack sizes.
- Extra long landing legs that clear the Ajax engines.
- Large radial decoupler with built-in sepratrons.
- Ablative heat shields.

Does this have docking ports? If not, may I suggest adding some? Maybe RCS too.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T15:06:53Z" title="06/21/2015 03:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by Whovian**

> 
> Does this have docking ports? If not, may I suggest adding some? Maybe RCS too.

Thanks for the suggestions, I will definitely consider it.
Version 1.2.2 is out, which balances parts with KSP 1.0.3 and fixes a minor landing leg issue.
At this point, could you toss the "1.03/4/whatever" in the thread title, so at a glance we can know when it's ready? Great work here, solid mod. Thanks for sharing this with us!

> 
> At this point, could you toss the "1.03/4/whatever" in the thread title, so at a glance we can know when it's ready? Great work here, solid mod. Thanks for sharing this with us!

My pleasure! Title edited to reflect KSP version.
Version 1.2.3 is out with more balancing to stock and KSP 1.0.4 compatibility.
Okay, guys - time to make your opinions count! See poll above.

Version 1.3.0 is out with loads of new parts:

- Bi-, tri-, and quad-couplers
- Docking ports
- Parachutes
- Solar panels

Enjoy!
I'm surprised none has mentioned the elephant rhino in a room yet.

> 
> I'm surprised none has mentioned the elephant rhino in a room yet.

Heh. Actually, Kottabos did a review of Behemoth Aerospace Engineering, not so long ago:
